title: Retrospective Exhibition of Paintings by Georgia O'Keeffe
description: A former student at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago, Georgia O’Keeffe had a warm and lifelong affinity for the Art Institute. She was particularly close to the Institute’s director Daniel Catton Rich (1939-1958), who offered her the opportunity of a retrospective exhibition at the museum in early 1943. Later in life, and in her bequest, O’Keeffe donated many works painted or collected by her and her husband, Alfred Stieglitz, to the museum.

input: Retrospective Exhibition of Paintings by Georgia O'Keeffe
